'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2023-08-18 15:49:12.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/utils/test_libc.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'swift/common/utils/__init__.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/common/utils/libc.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/0dac30a06dc8ea2293fcec364e4f0c5333a93569', 'message': "Split reserve functionality from C calls in fallocate

Create a new fallocate function in swift.common.utils.libc that's just
responsible for finding an appropriate C function and calling it. Move
punch_hole to utils.libc, too.

Rename the function in swift.common.utils to be fallocate_with_reserve.
Rework it a little to require explicit plumbing of reserve values and
whether they're a percentage; it's now just responsible for checking
reserve space before calling the libc function. Do our best to unify
the implementation of that check with that of fs_has_free_space.

Add an fallocate function in utils that emits a deprecation warning
then calls fallocate_with_reserve with the FALLOCATE_RESERVE and
FALLOCATE_IS_PERCENT globals; this is for the benefit of 3rd party
code that might be relying on the old name. Plan for removal somewhere
around the E release.

Update callers in diskfile to use fallocate_with_reserve, and plumb in
fallocate_reserve configs explicitly.

Drive-by: Always report sizes in bytes in errors when the allocation
would violate reserved space.

UpgradeImpact
=============
swift.common.utils.fallocate is now deprecated, and may be removed in
a future release. Existing callers should move to either

- swift.common.utils.fallocate_with_reserve, which requires explicitly
  passing in reserve values, or
- swift.common.utils.libc.fallocate, which just does the allocation
  without any reserve checking.

Related-Bug: #2031035
Change-Id: I617929dc2bec0cf80f6c16adc1f556556306a9b1
"}]
commit_message:
Split reserve functionality from C calls in fallocate

Create a new fallocate function in swift.common.utils.libc that's just
responsible for finding an appropriate C function and calling it. Move
punch_hole to utils.libc, too.

Rename the function in swift.common.utils to be fallocate_with_reserve.
Rework it a little to require explicit plumbing of reserve values and
whether they're a percentage; it's now just responsible for checking
reserve space before calling the libc function. Do our best to unify
the implementation of that check with that of fs_has_free_space.

Add an fallocate function in utils that emits a deprecation warning
then calls fallocate_with_reserve with the FALLOCATE_RESERVE and
FALLOCATE_IS_PERCENT globals; this is for the benefit of 3rd party
code that might be relying on the old name. Plan for removal somewhere
around the E release.

Update callers in diskfile to use fallocate_with_reserve, and plumb in
fallocate_reserve configs explicitly.

Drive-by: Always report sizes in bytes in errors when the allocation
would violate reserved space.

UpgradeImpact
=============
swift.common.utils.fallocate is now deprecated, and may be removed in
a future release. Existing callers should move to either

- swift.common.utils.fallocate_with_reserve, which requires explicitly
  passing in reserve values, or
- swift.common.utils.libc.fallocate, which just does the allocation
  without any reserve checking.

Related-Bug: #2031035
Change-Id: I617929dc2bec0cf80f6c16adc1f556556306a9b1

'_fallocate_enabled', True) class TestFallocateReserve(unittest.TestCase): def _statvfs_result(self, f_frsize, f_bavail): # Only 3 values are relevant to us, so use zeros for the rest f_blocks = 100 return posix.statvfs_result((0, f_frsize, f_blocks, 0, f_bavail, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0)) def test_disabled(self, sys_fallocate_mock, fstatvfs_mock): utils.disable_fallocate() utils.fallocate(123, 456) sys_fallocate_mock.assert_not_called() fstatvfs_mock.assert_not_called() def test_zero_reserve(self, sys_fallocate_mock, fstatvfs_mock): utils.fallocate(123, 456) fstatvfs_mock.assert_not_called() self.assertEqual(len(sys_fallocate_mock.mock_calls), 1) def test_enough_space(self, sys_fallocate_mock, fstatvfs_mock): # Want 1024 bytes in reserve plus 1023 allocated, and have 2 blocks # of size 1024 free, so succeed utils.FALLOCATE_RESERVE, utils.FALLOCATE_IS_PERCENT = \ utils.config_fallocate_value('1024') fstatvfs_mock.return_value = self._statvfs_result(1024, 2) utils.fallocate(88, 1023) def test_not_enough_space(self, sys_fallocate_mock, fstatvfs_mock): # Want 1024 bytes in reserve plus 1024 allocated, and have 2 blocks # of size 1024 free, so fail utils.FALLOCATE_RESERVE, utils.FALLOCATE_IS_PERCENT = \ utils.config_fallocate_value('1024') fstatvfs_mock.return_value = self._statvfs_result(1024, 2) with self.assertRaises(OSError) as catcher: utils.fallocate(88, 1024) self.assertEqual( str(catcher.exception), '[Errno %d] FALLOCATE_RESERVE fail 1024 <= 1024' % errno.ENOSPC) sys_fallocate_mock.assert_not_called() def test_not_enough_space_large(self, sys_fallocate_mock, fstatvfs_mock): # Want 1024 bytes in reserve plus 1GB allocated, and have 2 blocks # of size 1024 free, so fail utils.FALLOCATE_RESERVE, utils.FALLOCATE_IS_PERCENT = \ utils.config_fallocate_value('1024') fstatvfs_mock.return_value = self._statvfs_result(1024, 2) with self.assertRaises(OSError) as catcher: utils.fallocate(88, 1 << 30) self.assertEqual( str(catcher.exception), '[Errno %d] FALLOCATE_RESERVE fail %d <= 1024' % (errno.ENOSPC, ((2 * 1024) - (1 << 30)))) sys_fallocate_mock.assert_not_called() def test_enough_space_small_blocks(self, sys_fallocate_mock, fstatvfs_mock): # Want 1024 bytes in reserve plus 1023 allocated, and have 4 blocks # of size 512 free, so succeed utils.FALLOCATE_RESERVE, utils.FALLOCATE_IS_PERCENT = \ utils.config_fallocate_value('1024') fstatvfs_mock.return_value = self._statvfs_result(512, 4) utils.fallocate(88, 1023) def test_not_enough_space_small_blocks(self, sys_fallocate_mock, fstatvfs_mock): # Want 1024 bytes in reserve plus 1024 allocated, and have 4 blocks # of size 512 free, so fail utils.FALLOCATE_RESERVE, utils.FALLOCATE_IS_PERCENT = \ utils.config_fallocate_value('1024') fstatvfs_mock.return_value = self._statvfs_result(512, 4) with self.assertRaises(OSError) as catcher: utils.fallocate(88, 1024) self.assertEqual(fstatvfs_mock.mock_calls, [mock.call(88)]) self.assertEqual( str(catcher.exception), '[Errno %d] FALLOCATE_RESERVE fail 1024 <= 1024' % errno.ENOSPC) sys_fallocate_mock.assert_not_called() def test_free_space_under_reserve(self, sys_fallocate_mock, fstatvfs_mock): # Want 2048 bytes in reserve but have only 3 blocks of size 512, so # allocating even 0 bytes fails utils.FALLOCATE_RESERVE, utils.FALLOCATE_IS_PERCENT = \ utils.config_fallocate_value('2048') fstatvfs_mock.return_value = self._statvfs_result(512, 3) with self.assertRaises(OSError) as catcher: utils.fallocate(88, 0) self.assertEqual( str(catcher.exception), '[Errno %d] FALLOCATE_RESERVE fail 1536 <= 2048' % errno.ENOSPC) sys_fallocate_mock.assert_not_called() def test_all_reserved(self, sys_fallocate_mock, fstatvfs_mock): # Filesystem is empty, but our reserve is bigger than the # filesystem, so any allocation will fail utils.FALLOCATE_RESERVE, utils.FALLOCATE_IS_PERCENT = \ utils.config_fallocate_value('9999999999999') fstatvfs_mock.return_value = self._statvfs_result(1024, 100) self.assertRaises(OSError, utils.fallocate, 88, 0) sys_fallocate_mock.assert_not_called() def test_enough_space_pct(self, sys_fallocate_mock, fstatvfs_mock): # Want 1% reserved, filesystem has 3/100 blocks of size 1024 free # and file size is 2047, so succeed utils.FALLOCATE_RESERVE, utils.FALLOCATE_IS_PERCENT = \ utils.config_fallocate_value('1%') fstatvfs_mock.return_value = self._statvfs_result(1024, 3) utils.fallocate(88, 2047) def test_not_enough_space_pct(self, sys_fallocate_mock, fstatvfs_mock): # Want 1% reserved, filesystem has 3/100 blocks of size 1024 free # and file size is 2048, so fail utils.FALLOCATE_RESERVE, utils.FALLOCATE_IS_PERCENT = \ utils.config_fallocate_value('1%') fstatvfs_mock.return_value = self._statvfs_result(1024, 3) with self.assertRaises(OSError) as catcher: utils.fallocate(88, 2048) self.assertEqual( str(catcher.exception), '[Errno %d] FALLOCATE_RESERVE fail 1024 <= 1024' % errno.ENOSPC) sys_fallocate_mock.assert_not_called() def test_all_space_reserved_pct(self, sys_fallocate_mock, fstatvfs_mock): # Filesystem is empty, but our reserve is the whole filesystem, so # any allocation will fail utils.FALLOCATE_RESERVE, utils.FALLOCATE_IS_PERCENT = \ utils.config_fallocate_value('100%') fstatvfs_mock.return_value = self._statvfs_result(1024, 100) with self.assertRaises(OSError) as catcher: utils.fallocate(88, 0) self.assertEqual( str(catcher.exception), '[Errno %d] FALLOCATE_RESERVE fail 102400 <= 102400' % errno.ENOSPC) sys_fallocate_mock.assert_not_called()

commit_message:
[victoria] Ensure get_requests_for_local_unit doesn't fail on incomplete relation

This is a rebuild/make sync for charms to pickup the fix in charmhelpers to fix
any inadvertant accesses of ['ca'] in the relation data before it is available
from vault in the certificates relation.  Fix in charmhelpers is in [1].

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/830
Closes-Bug: #2028683

Change-Id: Ie7e69443ee181257d76fb4ca3e52a7ed20fdef61

commit_message:
[zed] Ensure get_requests_for_local_unit doesn't fail on incomplete relation

This is a rebuild/make sync for charms to pickup the fix in charmhelpers to fix
any inadvertant accesses of ['ca'] in the relation data before it is available
from vault in the certificates relation.  Fix in charmhelpers is in [1].

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/826
Closes-Bug: #2028683

Change-Id: Ib64e3b9476c4982aadc6112893799baafba69c77
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-aodh refs/changes/14/892014/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[train] Ensure get_requests_for_local_unit doesn't fail on incomplete relation

This is a rebuild/make sync for charms to pickup the fix in charmhelpers to fix
any inadvertant accesses of ['ca'] in the relation data before it is available
from vault in the certificates relation.  Fix in charmhelpers is in [1].

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/832
Closes-Bug: #2028683

Change-Id: I90e6bd083e3e232d6d011790cc5bc1dee1b924d1

commit_message:
Adopt for usage openstack_resources role

With efforts to create a resources in same, unified way,
we convert tempest role to use openstack_resources
for creating and managing openstack resources, like projects, flavors,
networks, images, etc. This should reduce maintenance costs
in case of futher collection updates and unify approach.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins/+/878794
Change-Id: I762ded9b6099ea55e8a19bfb82473b950155eaa4

commit_message:
Add enabled_provider_drivers

This patch deprecates enable_amphora and instead adds enabled_provider_drivers
which can be set to amphora OR ovn OR amphora,ovn. The default remains
amphora,ovn as previously.

Closes-Bug: #2029857
Change-Id: Ie5993d84cdb3b625cc21ed929c2b2ff8ffcb581f

commit_message:
[victoria] Ensure get_requests_for_local_unit doesn't fail on incomplete relation

This is a rebuild/make sync for charms to pickup the fix in charmhelpers to fix
any inadvertant accesses of ['ca'] in the relation data before it is available
from vault in the certificates relation.  Fix in charmhelpers is in [1].

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/830
Closes-Bug: #2028683

Change-Id: I17c4811a05600a3244dd8303c2c3fa87b33913f8

commit_message:
add support for microversion 2.93

Adds support for Nova API microversion 2.93 which allows
updating a server's user_data via the
PUT "/servers/{server_id}" API, or
POST "/servers/{server_id}/action" reboot API.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/816157
Change-Id: Ifa037938068ff9b68da5b9842d390dd4728764f3
Signed-off-by: Jan Hartkopf <jhartkopf@inovex.de>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/58/816158/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_update_with_userdata(self): self.run_command( 'update --userdata data sample-server', api_version='2.91') expected_put_body = { "server": { "user_data": "data" } } self.assert_called('GET', '/servers/1234', pos=-2) self.assert_called('PUT', '/servers/1234', expected_put_body, pos=-1) def test_update_with_userdata_pre_v291(self): self.assertRaises( SystemExit, self.run_command, 'update --userdata data sample-server', api_version='2.90')

commit_message:
Allow to manage more the one vhost with mq_setup

This change enables us to supply list of vhosts that needs to be
created or deleted, rather then support only single vhost creation

We also reduce code duplication by leveraging task includes.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/880031
Change-Id: I76548f45a20db29c1bfd5db332b490b670d973a4

commit_message:
Allow bind mount of types other than directory

It is possible to bind mount files as well as directories. Allow
this to happen in the LXC container config.

Change-Id: I8b9acd2cdd8cd6e7e77f2286a2c48ed4facdcfd9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/95/891695/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: when: - item.create | default('dir') == 'dir' line: "lxc.mount.entry = {{ item['mount_path'] }} {{ item['bind_dir_path'].lstrip('/') }} none bind,create={{ item.create | default('dir') }} 0 0"

commit_message:
Fix linters issue and metadata

With update of ansible-lint to version >=6.0.0 a lot of new
linters were added, that enabled by default. In order to comply
with linter rules we're applying changes to the role.

With that we also update metdata to reflect current state.

Change-Id: I13935aa1ae19449184053fc40cc64b09ed1ba9ef

commit_message:
[victoria] Ensure get_requests_for_local_unit doesn't fail on incomplete relation

This is a rebuild/make sync for charms to pickup the fix in charmhelpers to fix
any inadvertant accesses of ['ca'] in the relation data before it is available
from vault in the certificates relation.  Fix in charmhelpers is in [1].

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/830
Closes-Bug: #2028683

Change-Id: Iaed9ef60a54823cc7c808767d5addbd34539bf5a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceilometer refs/changes/84/891884/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use proper galera port in configuration

While <service>_galera_port is defined and used for db_setup
role, it's not in fact used in a connection string for oslo.db.

Change-Id: I94cc61d88b0ec54bde01477e8fba35e341afffa2

subject: Fix wrong nova-manage command in upgrade check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-04-19 11:45:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d551748c7f2402dd0f5ae2fdfbb176cf880ef058', 'message': 'Fix wrong nova-manage command in upgrade check

The nova-status upgrade check command has the wrong
command for the nova-manage commands that is used for
handling the machine type. This can be traced back

commit_message:
Fix wrong nova-manage command in upgrade check

The nova-status upgrade check command has the wrong
command for the nova-manage commands that is used for
handling the machine type. This can be traced back
multiple releases.

Change-Id: I47de00284b39a767620d7052bca687c2268dba33

Add two new scenario tests to cover basic usecases with routed provider
networks:
* test_routed_provider_net_basic
* test_routed_provider_net_basic_with_precreated_port

These tests use segments_client to manage segments and boot VM on those
segmented networks, and placement_client to check if the allocations
were created as expected.

Related-Blueprint: blueprint routed-networks-scheduling
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/749068
Change-Id: Ie45e231441bb699fffffebe50b35921dbefccca2

Add two new scenario tests to cover basic usecases with routed provider
networks:
* test_routed_provider_net_basic
* test_routed_provider_net_basic_with_precreated_port

These tests use segments_client to manage segments and boot VM on those
segmented networks, and placement_client to check if the allocations
were created as expected.
In the multihost environment used by zuul there's only 1 physnet, so
the tests can't add new segment for the 2nd host.

Related-Blueprint: blueprint routed-networks-scheduling
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/749068

commit_message:
Scenario test for routed provider networks

Add two new scenario tests to cover basic usecases with routed provider
networks:
* test_routed_provider_net_basic
* test_routed_provider_net_basic_with_precreated_port
* test_multiple_routed_provider_net_per_host

These tests use segments_client to manage segments and boot VM on those
segmented networks, and placement_client to check if the allocations
were created as expected.
In the multihost environment used by zuul there's only 1 physnet, so
the tests can't add new segment for the 2nd host.

Related-Bug: #1956435
Related-Bug: #1764738
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/815093
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/841838
Change-Id: Ie45e231441bb699fffffebe50b35921dbefccca2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/55/665155/43 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_log import log as logging from tempest.common import utils from tempest import config from tempest.lib import decorators from tempest.scenario import manager LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) CONF = config.CONF class RoutedProviderNetworksTest(manager.NetworkScenarioTest): credentials = ['primary', 'admin'] required_extensions = ['segments'] @classmethod def setup_clients(cls): super(RoutedProviderNetworksTest, cls).setup_clients() cls.placement_client = cls.os_admin.placement_client cls.networks_client = cls.os_admin.networks_client cls.subnets_client = cls.os_admin.subnets_client cls.routers_client = cls.os_adm.routers_client @decorators.idempotent_id('a7b07282-ffe7-4176-9d28-b7cb266ba203') @decorators.attr(type='slow') @utils.services('compute', 'network') def test_routed_provider_net_basic(self): """Basic scenario for routed provider networks. Steps: * Create provider network ** Check that related segment was created ** Create IPv4 subnet with the segment_id (with allocation_pools select a 1 ip wide range for easier testing) ** Check that *** aggregate for segment is created *** resource provider for segment is created *** IPV4_ADDRESS resoirce provider inventory is created for subnet * Create another segment (for 2nd host's physnet for example) ** Create an IPv4 subnet with the segment id (with allocation_pools select a 1 ip wide range for easier testing) ** Check the same as previously * Boot VM on the proivder network ** Check that ** the inventory of the given resource provider (the one for the segment on which the VM was booted) reserved number is changed. * Boot another VM ** Check that ** it is booted on the other host/segment ** Check if the inventory numbers are changed """

commit_message:
[train] Ensure get_requests_for_local_unit doesn't fail on incomplete relation

This is a rebuild/make sync for charms to pickup the fix in charmhelpers to fix
any inadvertant accesses of ['ca'] in the relation data before it is available
from vault in the certificates relation.  Fix in charmhelpers is in [1].

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/832
Closes-Bug: #2028683

commit_message:
libvirt: set remaining to 0 when no disk to migrate

If we dont have any disk to migrate we still get that
100% of the disk is remaining. This just changes the
log message to indicate 0% disk remaining when there
is no disk to migrate.

Change-Id: I82bfcf455a8920e2353bade6e4064f12b4869e4c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/46/873846/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: else: # There is no disk to migrate so nothing remains disk_remaining = 0

subject: Resolve multivalue group from claims
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-17 09:56:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/9de2272dc558bb864d955f9e7893dd448e2ce261', 'message': 'Resolve multivalue group from claims

The current implementation of the resolve_domain function doesn't
support a multivalue list of groups in the received claim. This
patch aims to fix it in a way that mainteins the current behavior
for non-multivalued groups.

The current mapping engine expects each group on a separate
object:

group: [{name:group1},{name:group2}]

Meanwhile the IdP sends a multivalue array of groups, the length
of which may vary depending of the user. Then the mapping engine
transform it to a string representation of an array.

IdP sends:
	[g1;g2;g3]

After mapping engine:
	"['g1','g2','g3']"

After apply the mapping rules, on the resolve_domain function:
	group: [{name:"[g1,g2,g3]"}]

Which raise an error "Group has no entry on the backend".

Change-Id: I8e14378c2654b93684b7179d92d74313f57c6411
Signed-off-by: Juan Pedro Torres <juanp.95.torres@gmail.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2023-08-17 11:40:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/ff04215e744255bc59be6725597adc22482772ac', 'message': 'Resolve multivalue group from claims

The current implementation of the resolve_domain function doesn't
support a multivalue list of groups in the received claim. This
patch aims to fix it in a way that mainteins the current behavior
for non-multivalued groups.

The current mapping engine expects each group on a separate
object:

group: [{name:group1},{name:group2}]

Meanwhile the IdP sends a multivalue array of groups, the length
of which may vary depending of the user. Then the mapping engine
transform it to a string representation of an array.

IdP sends:
	[g1;g2;g3]

After mapping engine:
	"['g1','g2','g3']"

After apply the mapping rules, on the resolve_domain function:
	group: [{name:"[g1,g2,g3]"}]

Which raise an error "Group has no entry on the backend".

Change-Id: I8e14378c2654b93684b7179d92d74313f57c6411
Signed-off-by: Juan Pedro Torres <juanp.95.torres@gmail.com>
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2023-08-17 18:59:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/282b59023b547d5d05fba897a22002aef5f85a4c', 'message': 'Resolve multivalue group from claims

The current implementation of the resolve_domain function doesn't
support a multivalue list of groups in the received claim. This
patch aims to fix it in a way that mainteins the current behavior
for non-multivalued groups.

The current mapping engine expects each group on a separate
object:

group: [{name:group1},{name:group2}]

Meanwhile the IdP sends a multivalue array of groups, the length
of which may vary depending of the user. Then the mapping engine
transform it to a string representation of an array.

IdP sends:
	[g1;g2;g3]

After mapping engine:
	"['g1','g2','g3']"

After apply the mapping rules, on the resolve_domain function:
	group: [{name:"[g1,g2,g3]"}]

Which raise an error "Group has no entry on the backend".

Change-Id: I8e14378c2654b93684b7179d92d74313f57c6411
Signed-off-by: Juan Pedro Torres <juanp.95.torres@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Resolve multivalue group from claims

The current implementation of the resolve_domain function doesn't
support a multivalue list of groups in the received claim. This
patch aims to fix it in a way that mainteins the current behavior
for non-multivalued groups.

The current mapping engine expects each group on a separate
object:

group: [{name:group1},{name:group2}]

Meanwhile the IdP sends a multivalue array of groups, the length
of which may vary depending of the user. Then the mapping engine
transform it to a string representation of an array.

IdP sends:
	[g1;g2;g3]

After mapping engine:
	"['g1','g2','g3']"

After apply the mapping rules, on the resolve_domain function:
	group: [{name:"[g1,g2,g3]"}]

Which raise an error "Group has no entry on the backend".

Change-Id: I8e14378c2654b93684b7179d92d74313f57c6411
Signed-off-by: Juan Pedro Torres <juanp.95.torres@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/15/891315/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: group_ids_array = [] try: val_group = ast.literal_eval(group['name']) for group_name in val_group: group_dict = identity_api.get_group_by_name( group_name,resolve_domain(group['domain'])) group_ids_array.append(group_dict['id']) yield from group_ids_array except ValueError: group_dict = identity_api.get_group_by_name( group['name'], resolve_domain(group['domain'])) yield group_dict['id']
deleted_lines: group_dict = identity_api.get_group_by_name( group['name'], resolve_domain(group['domain'])) yield group_dict['id']

commit_message:
Pin elasticsearch-curator==5.8.4

elasticsearch-curator 8 is out and is incompatible with Elasticsearch 7 release.
We pin curator version to release 5.8.4 which should support any Elasticsearch
7.x releases [1].
As elasticsearch has been dropped from Zed onwards, this only applies to Yoga
and below.

1. https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/client/curator/5.8/version-compatibility.html

Closes-Bug: #2028048
Change-Id: I976781ed0bdc47760163e25c480ca8fe93f66517
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/21/891721/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes an issue with Elasticsearch curator not working due to too new python elasticsearch-curator library not compatible with Elasticsearch version 7. `LP#2028048 <https://launchpad.net/kolla/+bug/2028048>`__

subject: Remove cluster_user
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-18 11:45:58.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/common/policies/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/1429abb7c5db252d82a077545c07e1eac6c4fe25', 'message': 'Remove cluster_user

This is now redundant. Magnum trusts are created with
'impersonation=True'[1]. With the trust token scope in Change
If5b31951959c7a141dc1cae5fefcabe4ebf438b3, auth tokens generated by
trustee user with "OS-TRUST:trust" scope have are have been changed from
having user_id of trustee, to trustor, due to impersonation[2].

 "If the trust has the impersonation attribute set to true, then the
resulting tokens user attribute will also represent the trustor, rather
than the authenticating user (the trustee)."

This means a policy matching for trustee, which used to be
 "user_id:%(trustee_user_id)s"
can now be matched by
 "user_id:%(user_id)s"

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/src/branch/stable/2023.1/magnum/common/keystone.py#L213
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3-ext/?expanded=consuming-a-trust-detail,create-trust-detail#consuming-a-trust

Change-Id: I7923fc8e66480f8c75b2c3025e4faefb2d20d925
'}]
commit_message:
Remove cluster_user

This is now redundant. Magnum trusts are created with
'impersonation=True'[1]. With the trust token scope in Change
If5b31951959c7a141dc1cae5fefcabe4ebf438b3, auth tokens generated by
trustee user with "OS-TRUST:trust" scope have are have been changed from
having user_id of trustee, to trustor, due to impersonation[2].

 "If the trust has the impersonation attribute set to true, then the
resulting tokens user attribute will also represent the trustor, rather
than the authenticating user (the trustee)."

This means a policy matching for trustee, which used to be
 "user_id:%(trustee_user_id)s"
can now be matched by
 "user_id:%(user_id)s"

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/src/branch/stable/2023.1/magnum/common/keystone.py#L213
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3-ext/?expanded=consuming-a-trust-detail,create-trust-detail#consuming-a-trust

Change-Id: I7923fc8e66480f8c75b2c3025e4faefb2d20d925
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/71/891971/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add STP option for bridge interfaces

For Rocky Linux 9, Kayobe will now disable STP on a bridge by default,
to preserve compatibility with network scripts, as Network Manager
enables STP on all bridges by default.
Enabling STP can lead to port down event if BPDU guard is enabled
on the switch.

Closes-Bug: #2028775

Change-Id: I35eaa92f4243af00697306aa801e5a733885ce4f

commit_message:
Define constraints file for docs and renos

Right now we are not using any constraints for docs and releasenotes builds.
This has resulted in docs job failures once Sphinx 7.2.0 has been released.

The patch will ensure that constraints are used an we should not face
simmilar issue again.

TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is updated by Release bot once new branch is created,
so it should always track relevant constraints.

Some extra syntax-related changes can apply, since patch is being passed
through ConfigParser, that does not preserve comments and align indenting.


Change-Id: Ia704b63838c8730039e135eb38e170204d5a30e2

commit_message:
Consider shared networks when creating router in project

The current code did not consider shared networks when checking
if a network existed in a project. The simplest solution is to
to stop filtering for networks in a specific project and let
neutron return an error when we create the router.

Story: 2010886
Task: 48649
Change-Id: I8e2202b1c38b438b4075edd0555c4b9856c736be

subject: systemd: handle running container without systemd unit
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-18 07:41:50.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/module_utils/kolla_docker_worker.py', 'tests/check-logs.sh', 'tests/kolla_docker_tests/test_docker_worker.py', 'ansible/module_utils/kolla_systemd_worker.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/a5addd82581e097d953287d70d44cb6ce652048b', 'message': 'systemd: handle running container without systemd unit

MariaDB bootstrap has a phase where the first MariaDB container
is running with Galera bootstrap - after a check that WSREP
is synced is successful - we restart the container.

The bootstrap container is named mariadb and running with
docker_restart_policy: "no" - the restarted container should be running
in systemd.

Before this patch the code created a systemd unit but it was initially
stopped - so stopping was always a success - and the container would be
killed with SIGKILL on removal (which obviously breaks MariaDB).

This patch also improves docker/systemd stops by waiting for real
unit/container stop and adds failing CI for containers that are
killed with signal 9.

Closes-Bug: #2029613

Change-Id: I0a03e509ce228a50e081fcab44d2b4831251190c
(cherry picked from commit 1497ab2ab30475083289cc1fea54464b695fca49)
'}]
commit_message:
systemd: handle running container without systemd unit

MariaDB bootstrap has a phase where the first MariaDB container
is running with Galera bootstrap - after a check that WSREP
is synced is successful - we restart the container.

The bootstrap container is named mariadb and running with
docker_restart_policy: "no" - the restarted container should be running
in systemd.

Before this patch the code created a systemd unit but it was initially
stopped - so stopping was always a success - and the container would be
killed with SIGKILL on removal (which obviously breaks MariaDB).

This patch also improves docker/systemd stops by waiting for real
unit/container stop and adds failing CI for containers that are
killed with signal 9.

Closes-Bug: #2029613

Change-Id: I0a03e509ce228a50e081fcab44d2b4831251190c
(cherry picked from commit 1497ab2ab30475083289cc1fea54464b695fca49)

subject: Use correct metadata for metrics gathered from gnocchi
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-10-19 17:03:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty/commit/db7af33206d9ec60b84c3ab0e2678ca593e4701b', 'message': 'Use correct metadata for metrics gathered from gnocchi

Gnocchi fixed its `aggregates` API with PR
https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi/pull/1059. Before that patch,
the `aggregates` API would only return the latest metadata for the
resource of the metric being handled. Therefore, for CloudKitty
processing and reprocessing, we would always have the possibility of
using the wrong attribute version to rate the computing resources.

With this patch we propose to always use the correct metadata for the
processing and reprocessing of CloudKitty. This means, we always use
the metadata for the timestamp that we are collecting at Gnocchi.

This also means that we need to depende on the newest version of
Gnocchi that has not been released yet.

Change-Id: I31bc2cdf620fb5c0f561dc9de8c10d7882895cce

commit_message:
Use correct metadata for metrics gathered from gnocchi

Gnocchi fixed its `aggregates` API with PR
https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi/pull/1059. Before that patch,
the `aggregates` API would only return the latest metadata for the
resource of the metric being handled. Therefore, for CloudKitty
processing and reprocessing, we would always have the possibility of
using the wrong attribute version to rate the computing resources.
With this patch we propose to always use the correct metadata for the
processing and reprocessing of CloudKitty. This means, we always use
the metadata for the timestamp that we are collecting at Gnocchi.

The patch was released under version 4.5.0 of Gnocchi.

Change-Id: I31bc2cdf620fb5c0f561dc9de8c10d7882895cce

commit_message:
loadbalancer: remove support for haproxy_processes

Threads are the recommended way to scale CPU performance since HAProxy
1.8.

Official documentation says:  While "nbproc" historically used to be the only
way to use multiple processors, it also involved a number of shortcomings
related to the lack of synchronization between processes (health-checks, peers,
stick-tables, stats, ...) which do not affect threads. As such, any modern
configuration is strongly encouraged to migrate away from "nbproc" to
"nbthread". .

Change-Id: I6f2e9d74e68703c8e0827e495945a75f020e1561

commit_message:
direct_client: support extra request params for direct_get_container.

While the existing named kwargs (marker, limit, prefix and etc)
are common parameters among different use cases of
direct_get_container, a new 'extra_params' kwarg is added to
support additional private parameters for each individual use case.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistairncoles@gmail.com>
Change-Id: If1d355fbc5d292cee4f44c0e5dc52e5df9ae990b

The usages for this function includes shard_range/namespace listing and object listing, while the named kwargs (marker, limit, prefix, delimiter, end_marker, reverse) are common parameters among those usages, and ``extra_params`` is used to pass private parameters for each individual use case. For example, ['states=updating'] can be used with shard_range/namespace listing. Note: common parameters passed into ``extra_params`` will be ignored, and this interface will only verify the basic format of extra parameters. headers=headers, extra_params=extra_params)

commit_message:
Add upper limit for Sphinx and docutils

Sphinux 5.0.0 introduces new warnings which mean that docs fail to
biuild.  docutils enables smart_quotes which causes docs to fail to
build.  The TC decided just to cap these tools so let's do that to
make adding new constraints "easier"

Change-Id: I5be8e0a91d85babd14ec7cb1e391c17f3d27e224

commit_message:
Remove superfluous sudo

In a recent test run for neutron-dynamic-routing I noticed
the command 'sudo sudo docker images'. Remove the superfluous
'sudo' as it is unnecessary.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I89479892b2a8f887fecce597d288898707ae4127

commit_message:
[xena] Ensure get_requests_for_local_unit doesn't fail on incomplete relation

This is a rebuild/make sync for charms to pickup the fix in charmhelpers to fix
any inadvertant accesses of ['ca'] in the relation data before it is available
from vault in the certificates relation.  Fix in charmhelpers is in [1].

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/828
Closes-Bug: #2028683

Change-Id: Ic4f9f4e640fefaba9bba486737447e25674359f7

commit_message:
Add stack domain configurations

Add stack domain name, stack domain admin user,
stack user role in heat configuration.
Perform the domain setup like creation of domain,
creation of admin user in the heat domain and
creation of stack user role.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-keystone-k8s/+/891651
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-ops-sunbeam/+/891654
Change-Id: Ib86d4019027e6da5188ecc714f86cb1595ffd4fa

commit_message:
[xena] Ensure get_requests_for_local_unit doesn't fail on incomplete relation

This is a rebuild/make sync for charms to pickup the fix in charmhelpers to fix
any inadvertant accesses of ['ca'] in the relation data before it is available
from vault in the certificates relation.  Fix in charmhelpers is in [1].

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/828
Closes-Bug: #2028683

Change-Id: I132dbeeb7e3cf2c6c65110865a9f39ca4b6cc772
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-manila refs/changes/10/891710/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Sanitize any secrets sent as part of identity-resource ops
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-18 06:18:52.000000000', 'files': ['lib/charms/keystone_k8s/v0/identity_resource.py', 'src/charm.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-keystone-k8s/commit/e487f8129b60bf94fccd1f24da134a8109f72a98', 'message': 'Sanitize any secrets sent as part of identity-resource ops

There could be sensitive data in the request ops sent via
identity-resource relation like passwords. If secrets are
sent instead of plain sensitive data, santize them and
retrieve sensitive data from the secret before performing
keystone operation.

For the requester charm, to grant access to secrets, the
events should pass relation details and so change events
in identity-resource requires to RelationEvent type.

Change-Id: I1c7aa9e8792d8a3924f79acf0dddfa80ae1ab2c3
'}]
commit_message:
Sanitize any secrets sent as part of identity-resource ops

There could be sensitive data in the request ops sent via
identity-resource relation like passwords. If secrets are
sent instead of plain sensitive data, santize them and
retrieve sensitive data from the secret before performing
keystone operation.

For the requester charm, to grant access to secrets, the
events should pass relation details and so change events
in identity-resource requires to RelationEvent type.

Change-Id: I1c7aa9e8792d8a3924f79acf0dddfa80ae1ab2c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-keystone-k8s refs/changes/43/891943/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ModelError,SECRET_PREFIX = "secret://" def _sanitize_secrets(self, request: dict) -> dict: """Sanitize any secrets. Look for any secrets in op parameters and retrieve the secret value. Use the same parameter name while retrieving value from secret. """ for op in request.get("ops", []): for param, value in op.get("params", {}).items(): if isinstance(value, str) and value.startswith(SECRET_PREFIX): try: credentials = self.model.get_secret(id=value) op["params"][param] = credentials.get_content().get( param ) except (ModelError, SecretNotFoundError) as e: logger.debug( f"Not able to retrieve secret {value}: {str(e)}" ) return request "handle_ops_from_event: Service not ready, request " f"{event.request} not processed" request = self._sanitize_secrets(request)
deleted_lines: f"handle_ops_from_event: Service not ready, request {event.request} not processed"

commit_message:
Add relation handler for ceph-access relation

Change-Id: If5f91e9a8996db5bbc26b135d9956321b196589d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ops-sunbeam refs/changes/95/885295/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Create a new ceph-access handler. """Configure event handlers for ceph-access relation.""" logger.debug("Setting up the ceph-access event handler") class CephAccessRequiresHandler(RelationHandler): """Handles the ceph access relation on the requires side.""" def __init__( self, charm: ops.charm.CharmBase, relation_name: str, callback_f: Callable, mandatory: bool = False, ) -> None: """Create a new ceph-access handler. Create a new CephAccessRequiresHandler that handles initial events from the relation and invokes the provided callbacks based on the event raised. :param charm: the Charm class the handler is for :type charm: ops.charm.CharmBase :param relation_name: the relation the handler is bound to :type relation_name: str :param callback_f: the function to call when the nodes are connected :type callback_f: Callable """ super().__init__(charm, relation_name, callback_f, mandatory) def setup_event_handler(self) -> ops.charm.Object: """Configure event handlers for ceph-access relation.""" import charms.cinder_ceph_k8s.v0.ceph_access as ceph_access logger.debug("Setting up the ceph-access event handler") ceph_access = ceph_access.CephAccessRequires( self.charm, self.relation_name, ) self.framework.observe( ceph_access.on.ready, self._ceph_access_ready ) self.framework.observe( ceph_access.on.goneaway, self._ceph_access_goneaway ) return ceph_access def _ceph_access_ready(self, event: ops.framework.EventBase) -> None: """React to credential ready event.""" self.callback_f(event) def _ceph_access_goneaway(self, event: ops.framework.EventBase) -> None: """React to credential goneaway event.""" self.callback_f(event) if self.mandatory: self.status.set(BlockedStatus("integration missing")) @property def ready(self) -> bool: """Whether handler is ready for use.""" try: return bool(self.interface.ready) except (AttributeError, KeyError): return False def context(self) -> dict: """Context containing Ceph access data.""" ctxt = super().context() data = self.interface.ceph_access_data ctxt["key"] = data.get("key") ctxt["uuid"] = data.get("uuid") return ctxt
deleted_lines: """Create a new identity-credentials handler. """Configure event handlers for identity-credentials relation.""" logger.debug("Setting up the identity-credentials event handler")

commit_message:
Add openEuler 22.03 LTS support

openEuler is an open-source Linux based operating system. The current
openEuler kernel is based on Linux and supports multi arch, such as
X86_64 and aarch64. It fully unleashes the potential of computing chips.
As an efficient, stable, and secure open-source OS built by global
open-source contributors, openEuler applies to database, big data, cloud
computing, and AI scenarios. openEuler is using RPM for package
management.

This Patch add the openEuler distro support. And add the related
CI job to make sure its works well.

Website: https://www.openeuler.org/en/

commit_message:
Add retries to LXC base build command

Sometimes there could be intermittent issues on some of the
mirrors that would be picked while building the base image.

In order to increases chances of image to build, we add a retries
to increase chances to pick properly synced mirror.

Change-Id: I5546ee71cce4f4b40fbd1d38d5d49586606bbbda

commit_message:
[xena] Ensure get_requests_for_local_unit doesn't fail on incomplete relation

This is a rebuild/make sync for charms to pickup the fix in charmhelpers to fix
any inadvertant accesses of ['ca'] in the relation data before it is available
from vault in the certificates relation.  Fix in charmhelpers is in [1].

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/828
Closes-Bug: #2028683

Change-Id: If06ad8d782a47edaa320da8d710211f3ec04e28c

'}, {'number': 20, 'created': '2023-08-03 08:00:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/aefcb7327e80f8011bf34a98ae133518d556166e', 'message': 'systemd: wait for stopping container

'}, {'number': 21, 'created': '2023-08-03 14:28:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/fb07dabcc5af60e487999584ffe971cd9ff3e50e', 'message': 'systemd: handle running container without systemd unit

MariaDB bootstrap has a phase where first MariaDB container
is running with Galera bootstrap - after a check that WSREP
is synced is successful - we restart the container.

The bootstrap container is named mariadb and running with
docker_restart_policy: "no" - the restarted should be running
in systemd.

Before this patch the code created systemd unit but it was initially
stopped - so stopping was always a success - and container would be
killed with SIGKILL on removal (which obviously breaks MariaDB).

Change-Id: I0a03e509ce228a50e081fcab44d2b4831251190c

commit_message:
systemd: handle running container without systemd unit

MariaDB bootstrap has a phase where the first MariaDB container
is running with Galera bootstrap - after a check that WSREP
is synced is successful - we restart the container.

The bootstrap container is named mariadb and running with
docker_restart_policy: "no" - the restarted container should be running
in systemd.

Before this patch the code created a systemd unit but it was initially
stopped - so stopping was always a success - and the container would be
killed with SIGKILL on removal (which obviously breaks MariaDB).

This patch also improves docker/systemd stops by waiting for real
unit/container stop and adds failing CI for containers that are
killed with signal 9.

Closes-Bug: #2029613

Change-Id: I0a03e509ce228a50e081fcab44d2b4831251190c

commit_message:
Fix share network delete procedure

Currently, delete of share network leaves security service associations
behind it. DB purge job can't process them because they are constrained
to soft-deleted networks. Proposed patch fixes both formation of
orphaned associations and seamless purging of them.

Closes-Bug: #2029366
Change-Id: I9593dd6e89b2d290d3919c92d209132e1cec84f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/78/891778/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Deleting rows in share_network_security_service_association # related to deleted network or security service sec_assoc_to_delete = session.query( models.ShareNetworkSecurityServiceAssociation).join( models.ShareNetwork).join(models.SecurityService).filter( or_(models.ShareNetwork.deleted_at <= deleted_age, models.SecurityService.deleted_at <= deleted_age)).all() for assoc in sec_assoc_to_delete: with session.begin_nested(): session.delete(assoc)

commit_message:
[xena] Ensure get_requests_for_local_unit doesn't fail on incomplete relation

This is a rebuild/make sync for charms to pickup the fix in charmhelpers to fix
any inadvertant accesses of ['ca'] in the relation data before it is available
from vault in the certificates relation.  Fix in charmhelpers is in [1].

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/828
Closes-Bug: #2028683

Change-Id: I82feede2cb6ee134acb8e2b74533a4cffaaa4c3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-glance refs/changes/04/891704/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
fix: Add GLOBAL_VENV into skyline devstack plugin script

The devstack project has added GLOBAL_VENV env to adjust
the python env. So skyline needs to adjust the same check.

Change-Id: I5f5c3d40dc706cca2f2a91b48db50de67cb140e3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/skyline-apiserver refs/changes/41/891941/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ "$GLOBAL_VENV" == "True" ]]; then run_process "skyline" "$DEVSTACK_VENV/bin/gunicorn -c /etc/skyline/gunicorn.py skyline_apiserver.main:app" else run_process "skyline" "/usr/local/bin/gunicorn -c /etc/skyline/gunicorn.py skyline_apiserver.main:app" fi

commit_message:
Improve the reconciling for VPNaaS

 * Update the router info with current data on update / sync
   Since the sync method should reconcile out of any state, we need
   to update the router we store locally in the driver to ensure we
   have not missed e.g. a ha_state_change.

 * Ensure NAT rules are current by using a tag to clean them all and
   freshly create the currently required rules via iptables manager

 * ipsec stroke up-nb does always exits with rc 0, check stderr "start"

   A switch to using the VICI ([1]) via swanctl might be a bigger
   improvement, but that's a bigger change as it requires additional
   dependencies

Closes-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1943449

[1] https://docs.strongswan.org/docs/5.9/plugins/vici.html

Change-Id: I378ba5a0b500110ce5f9293a885730c0a62578b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/45/875745/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def ensure_nat_rules(self, vpnservice): """Ensure the required nat rules for ipsec exist in iptables. commit_message:
[xena] Ensure get_requests_for_local_unit doesn't fail on incomplete relation

This is a rebuild/make sync for charms to pickup the fix in charmhelpers to fix
any inadvertant accesses of ['ca'] in the relation data before it is available
from vault in the certificates relation.  Fix in charmhelpers is in [1].

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/828
Closes-Bug: #2028683

Change-Id: I9981aad11d9372b29b0095f56d3f04c1471fe4b0

commit_message:
new spec: support of vnc console for mks

Change-Id: I7776ae7210ad6fb22c3689ad4d57ecb73006aaa6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/57/889857/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================================= VNC console support for MKS ========================================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/mks-proxy The feature aims at providing a vnc console for MKS console. This is a proposal to add support for the bMKS console available in vSphere. Problem description =================== End users often have to troubleshoot their instances because they might have broken their boot configuration or locked themselves out with a firewall. Keyboard-Video-Mouse (KVM) access is often required for troubleshooting these types of issues as serial access is not always available or correctly configured. Also, KVM provides a better user experience as compared to serial console. Horizon's VNC console is not working for ESXi nodes provisioned by Nova. This spec intends to extend that to graphical console via the mks proxy. Use Cases --------- The end user will be able to get workable mks console url from ESXi server. nova-mksproxy should be deployed Proposed change =============== The proposal is to add a new console type "mks" that will return mks connect information similar to how we return connect information for other types of consoles like VNC and RDP. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- We will use the same security model as for the other types of consoles which is leveraging nova-consoleauth to authorize tokens generated by the compute node. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- MKS consoles will require deploying nova-mksproxy (similar to nova-novncproxy) that will connect compute service users to the corresponding vCenter which provides console access to the given virtual machine. There will be some new configuration options that will specify the parameter for the nova-mksproxy. ``nova-mksproxy/nova.conf``: [DEFAULT] web = /usr/share/vmware-mks [mks] enabled = true mksproxy_host = <mks-proxy-ip> mksproxy_port = 6090 ``nova-compute/nova.conf``: [mks] enabled = true mksproxy_base_url = http://<mks-proxy-ip>:6090/vnc_auto.html Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: alecorps7 Other contributors: None Feature Liaison --------------- None Work Items ---------- None Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= None Documentation Impact ==================== update required https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/remote-console-access.html https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/admin/console.html References ========== * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/mks-proxy - blueprint * https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/863090 - gerrit review nova History ======= None

commit_message:
Have host look for CPU controller of cgroupsv2 location.

Make the host class look under '/sys/fs/cgroup/cgroup.controllers' for support of the cpu controller. The host will try searching through cgroupsv1 first, just like up until now, and in the case that fails, it will try cgroupsv2 then. The host will not support the feature if both checks fail.

This new check needs to be mocked by all tests that focus on this piece of code, as it touches a system file that requires privileges. For such thing, the CGroupsFixture is defined to easily add suck mocking to all test cases that require so.

I also removed old mocking at test_driver.py in favor of the fixture from above.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE(auniyal):
- as new cgroup fixture is added, removed old mocking in few more unit test cases in test_driver
- did not remove test_guest_cpu_shares_with_multi_vcpu from test_driver

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/fixtures/nova.py
    nova/tests/functional/libvirt/base.py
    nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_vpmem.py
    nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1595962.py
    nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE(auniyal): backport to stable/wallaby
- tests/fixtures.py: Added CGroupsFixture in tests/fixtures as tests/fixtures/nova.py does
not exists in stable/wallaby
- fixed/updated imports for cgroup fixture in unit and functionl test

commit_message:
[2023.1] Ensure get_requests_for_local_unit doesn't fail on incomplete relation

This is a rebuild/make sync for charms to pickup the fix in charmhelpers to fix
any inadvertant accesses of ['ca'] in the relation data before it is available
from vault in the certificates relation.  Fix in charmhelpers is in [1].

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/825
Closes-Bug: #2028683

Change-Id: I9f195752974b350e5cd4f1577d6225e0251f158d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-glance refs/changes/34/891534/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sent = relation_get(rid=rid, unit=local_unit()) legacy_keys = ['certificate_name', 'common_name'] is_legacy_request = set(sent).intersection(legacy_keys) # Note: Bug#2028683 - data may not be available if the certificates # relation hasn't been populated by the providing charm. If no 'ca' # in the data then don't attempt the bundle at all. if data.get('ca'): if data.get(raw_certs_key): bundles.append({ 'ca': data['ca'], 'chain': data.get('chain'), 'certs': json.loads(data[raw_certs_key]) }) elif is_legacy_request: bundles.append({ 'ca': data['ca'], 'chain': data.get('chain'), 'certs': { sent['common_name']: { 'cert': data.get(local_name + '.server.cert'), 'key': data.get(local_name + '.server.key') } } })
deleted_lines: if data.get(raw_certs_key): bundles.append({ 'ca': data['ca'], 'chain': data.get('chain'), 'certs': json.loads(data[raw_certs_key])})

commit_message:
Don't hold on to the API request dbapi

... And only execute the loader once.

We now use a cached dbapi instance, and then set the object
on the request to None, disconnecting the request from the
request from the database, which doesn't need to be held
open any longer than absolutely necessary.

Interestingly... locally, my total unit test time dropped with this
change from an aggregate around 200 seconds to 130-140 seconds. It
seems there was quite a bit of overhead in that call to begin with.

Change-Id: Ibffbc0b14d3b908f772b2cac8c6fedae432b267a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/72/891872/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Call once, don't call on each request because it is # a ton of extra overhead. DBAPI = dbapi.get_instance() state.request.dbapi = DBAPI def after(self, state): # Explicitly set to None since we don't need the DB connection # after we're done processing the request. state.request.dbapi = None

commit_message:
Retry connecting vmedia through a DVD device if available

Currently, it is not possible to use virtual media based provisioning on
servers that only support DVD MediaTypes and do not support CD
MediaTypes. This change adds support for DVD-only virtual media. In
addition to this, it adds hanling of BadRequestException on attempt to
insert virtual media, so that instead of giving up on the first failure
encountered, the code continues to iterate through the list of other
virtual media devices available on the system and attempts to insert
media into the next suitable device till it either suceeds or runs out of
devices to try.

Change-Id: I0bb0ad5df613df86cd8a7686f9c32e902826cd20
Closes-Bug: #2031595

Falling back to " "%(available_device)s.", {'requested_device': sushy.VIRTUAL_MEDIA_DVD, 'available_device': sushy.VIRTUAL_MEDIA_DVD}) else: continue

commit_message:
LVM: Use --readonly where possible for lvs/vgs

Run lvs/vgs commands with --readonly where possible
to improve performance and reduce lock contention around
LVM metadata.

Change-Id: I1e9ce0efa32c1b52f21540a14cd5bdf7b3d41ef2

commit_message:
[WIP] Add multinode job for cephfs/nfs

A multinode job creates a controller node
that runs manila; and an additional compute
node to spread the compute VM workload around.

Depends-On: I84249ae268dfe00a112c67e5170b679acb318a25
Change-Id: I5162815b66d3f3e8cf8c1e246b61b0ea06c1a270
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[2023.1] Ensure get_requests_for_local_unit doesn't fail on incomplete relation

This is a rebuild/make sync for charms to pickup the fix in charmhelpers to fix
any inadvertant accesses of ['ca'] in the relation data before it is available
from vault in the certificates relation.  Fix in charmhelpers is in [1].

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/825
Closes-Bug: #2028683

Change-Id: Ifbfd7571de866bb4e89a84bef966ae62e8b42410
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-swift-proxy refs/changes/49/891549/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Note: Bug#2028683 - data may not be available if the certificates # relation hasn't been populated by the providing charm. If no 'ca' # in the data then don't attempt the bundle at all. if data.get('ca'): if data.get(raw_certs_key): bundles.append({ 'ca': data['ca'], 'chain': data.get('chain'), 'certs': json.loads(data[raw_certs_key]) }) elif is_legacy_request: bundles.append({ 'ca': data['ca'], 'chain': data.get('chain'), 'certs': { sent['common_name']: { 'cert': data.get(local_name + '.server.cert'), 'key': data.get(local_name + '.server.key') } } })
deleted_lines: if data.get(raw_certs_key): bundles.append({ 'ca': data['ca'], 'chain': data.get('chain'), 'certs': json.loads(data[raw_certs_key])}) elif is_legacy_request: bundles.append({ 'ca': data['ca'], 'chain': data.get('chain'), 'certs': {sent['common_name']: {'cert': data.get(local_name + '.server.cert'), 'key': data.get(local_name + '.server.key')}}})

commit_message:
Fix file matchers for loci jobs

In this PR https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-images/+/887596
while debugging we removed the zuul.d/openstack-loci.yaml file
as a job dependency. This prevented upload and promote jobs
to be launched.

Change-Id: I8df92d48ddee72c4c49214dad1cc4b095a7d2aed

commit_message:
RBD: Skip update_features when features = 0

librbd errors when update_features is called w/
features = 0 -- when this situation would occur,
skip calling update_features.

Closes-Bug: #1997980
Change-Id: Iab6a990ce7dee2c13deb4f46aeec0f46ffb7cd62
(cherry picked from commit 6e08f15074baa608d238959aa8f3fd6c9838ad7d)

subject: hash-ring: Retry all DB operations if inactive
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-14 12:53:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/ovn_hash_ring_db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/7364c5527fd065802ab60650bbcd893c89422050', 'message': 'hash-ring: Retry all DB operations if inactive

Neutron should be resilient to scenarios where connectivity to a service
Neutron depends on is lost. SQL database is one of it and hash ring DB
operations is used very early in the Neutron startup process.

If the connection is lost right after new API worker was spawned then
OVN IDLs are not instantiated and Neutron silently hangs on each request
that uses OVN DB because the event signaling OVN is ready never happens.

Closes-bug: #2029297
Change-Id: Id5bc24b76b7aa510d4066fbc5f7b8037cc8c740d

commit_message:
hash-ring: Retry all DB operations if inactive

Neutron should be resilient to scenarios where connectivity to a service
Neutron depends on is lost. SQL database is one of it and hash ring DB
operations is used very early in the Neutron startup process.

If the connection is lost right after new API worker was spawned then
OVN IDLs are not instantiated and Neutron silently hangs on each request
that uses OVN DB because the event signaling OVN is ready never happens.

Closes-bug: #2029297
Change-Id: Id5bc24b76b7aa510d4066fbc5f7b8037cc8c740d
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit a505ff7dbb4f0b7f5487fa8389842dd3ee583d50)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/74/891274/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
hash-ring: Retry all DB operations if inactive

Neutron should be resilient to scenarios where connectivity to a service
Neutron depends on is lost. SQL database is one of it and hash ring DB
operations is used very early in the Neutron startup process.

If the connection is lost right after new API worker was spawned then
OVN IDLs are not instantiated and Neutron silently hangs on each request
that uses OVN DB because the event signaling OVN is ready never happens.

commit_message:
Reduce the tempest concurrency (4) for a few jobs

The lvm-lio job family, the cbak-ceph job and
the lvm-multiattach job (especially the latter)
fail very frequently.
They used to run with --concurrency 6 on the gates,
a lower concurrency level can help with resource issues.

Change-Id: Iae6ae1b9662816097a998e7203777d971df4c40a

commit_message:
[victoria] Ensure get_requests_for_local_unit doesn't fail on incomplete relation

This is a rebuild/make sync for charms to pickup the fix in charmhelpers to fix
any inadvertant accesses of ['ca'] in the relation data before it is available
from vault in the certificates relation.  Fix in charmhelpers is in [1].

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/830
Closes-Bug: #2028683

Change-Id: I18a54a4acb953551b816a9d3506e39f5473b7d28

commit_message:
Add min_bytes arg to drain_and_close

We may want to drain_and_close an iter, but with a cap on the number
of bytes drained.

added_lines: from test.unit.common.middleware.helpers import LeakTrackingIter yield 'xx' yield 'yy' drained = [False] mark_closed = mock.MagicMock() mark_read = mock.MagicMock() tracker = LeakTrackingIter(gen(), mark_closed, mark_read, 'test_drain_and_close') utils.drain_and_close(tracker, min_bytes=3) # drain_and_close actually reads 4 bytes in order to reach min_bytes self.assertEqual(4, tracker.bytes_read) # but the iterator did not exit self.assertFalse(drained[0]) mark_read.assert_not_called() mark_closed.assert_called_once_with('test_drain_and_close') drained = [False] mark_closed = mock.MagicMock() mark_read = mock.MagicMock() tracker = LeakTrackingIter(gen(), mark_closed, mark_read, 'test_drain_and_close') utils.drain_and_close(tracker, min_bytes=4) self.assertEqual(4, tracker.bytes_read) # but still the iterator did not exit self.assertFalse(drained[0]) mark_read.assert_not_called() mark_closed.assert_called_once_with('test_drain_and_close') drained = [False] mark_closed = mock.MagicMock() mark_read = mock.MagicMock() tracker = LeakTrackingIter(gen(), mark_closed, mark_read, 'test_drain_and_close') utils.drain_and_close(tracker, min_bytes=5) # the iterator did exit! self.assertTrue(drained[0]) self.assertEqual(4, tracker.bytes_read) mark_read.assert_called_once_with('test_drain_and_close') mark_closed.assert_called_once_with('test_drain_and_close') drained = [False] mark_closed = mock.MagicMock() mark_read = mock.MagicMock() tracker = LeakTrackingIter(gen(), mark_closed, mark_read, 'test_drain_and_close') utils.drain_and_close(tracker, min_bytes=0) # the iterator did exit! self.assertTrue(drained[0]) self.assertEqual(4, tracker.bytes_read) mark_read.assert_called_once_with('test_drain_and_close') mark_closed.assert_called_once_with('test_drain_and_close')

commit_message:
Update Cirros image to 0.6.2

LIBVIRT_CPU_MODE: host-passthrough was commented
as there was some issue with 0.6.1. 0.6.2 is known
to have the fix included, so let's use that instead.

Change-Id: I534d537400fa67796a64a550b3fe45a3b28f250e

commit_message:
Add method for getting redacted copy of context

There are times, such as in oslo.messaging notifications, when we'd like
a context object to be stripped of any secrets. This adds a method to
RequestContext, redacted_copy(), which returns a copy of that context,
carrying over an allowlist of fields only, leaving secrets behind.

Related-bug: 2030976
Change-Id: Ie4a8eb784c505c41ec5fcd4cba091cc555146763
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.context refs/changes/08/891608/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def redacted_copy(self) -> 'RequestContext': """Return a copy of the context with sensitive fields redacted. This is useful for creating a context that can be safely logged. :returns: A copy of the context with sensitive fields redacted. """ return self.__class__( user_id=self.user_id, project_id=self.project_id, domain_id=self.domain_id, user_domain_id=self.user_domain_id, project_domain_id=self.project_domain_id, request_id=self.request_id, roles=self.roles, user_name=self.user_name, project_name=self.project_name, domain_name=self.domain_name, user_domain_name=self.user_domain_name, project_domain_name=self.project_domain_name, service_user_id=self.service_user_id, service_user_domain_id=self.service_user_domain_id, service_user_domain_name=self.service_user_domain_name, service_project_id=self.service_project_id, service_project_name=self.service_project_name, service_project_domain_id=self.service_project_domain_id, service_project_domain_name=self.service_project_domain_name, service_roles=self.service_roles, global_request_id=self.global_request_id, system_scope=self.system_scope, user=self.user, domain=self.domain, user_domain=self.user_domain, project_domain=self.project_domain )

commit_message:
Clean up rocky branch filters

Rocky transitioned to End of Life [1] so let's remove all
stable/rocky related filters from the zuul jobs.

[1] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2023-January/031922.html

Change-Id: Id8b5001955d9d6d2631e1eb88364e379f44e7ee7

added_lines: branches: ^(?!stable/(stein|train|ussuri|victoria|wallaby|xena|yoga|zed)).*$ branches: ^(?!stable/(stein|train|ussuri|victoria|wallaby|xena|yoga|zed)).*$ branches: ^(?!stable/(stein|train|ussuri|victoria|wallaby|xena|yoga|zed)).*$ branches: ^(?!stable/(stein|train|ussuri|victoria|wallaby|xena|yoga|zed)).*$ branches: ^(?!stable/(stein|train|ussuri|victoria|wallaby|xena|yoga|zed)).*$ branches: ^(?!stable/(stein|train|ussuri|victoria|wallaby|xena|yoga|zed)).*$
deleted_lines: name: build-openstack-sphinx-docs parent: build-sphinx-docs branches: stable/rocky nodeset: ubuntu-xenial description: | Builds documentation using Sphinx per a previous version of the OpenStack PTI and then collects the results into the log directory so that they can be examined in their published form after a successful build. It runs the prepare-docs-for-afs role so that AFS stamp files can be examined if desired, and also validates htaccess files using the whereto tool. Processing upper-constraints files from openstack/requirements. This job runs on Xenial for stable/rocky. Let's # pin tox <4 for stable branches testing (<=stable/zed). ensure_tox_version: '<4' timeout: 3000 branches: - stable/rocky - job: branches: ^(?!stable/(rocky|stein|train|ussuri|victoria|wallaby|xena|yoga|zed)).*$ name: openstack-tox-functional parent: openstack-tox description: | Run tox-based (xenial) functional tests for an OpenStack Python project. Uses tox with the ``functional`` environment. This job runs on xenial for stable/rocky. irrelevant-files: *common-irrelevant-files nodeset: ubuntu-xenial branches: - stable/rocky vars: tox_envlist: functional - job: branches: ^(?!stable/(rocky|stein|train|ussuri|victoria|wallaby|xena|yoga|zed)).*$ name: openstack-tox-functional-with-sudo parent: openstack-tox-with-sudo description: | Run tox-based (xenial) functional tests for an OpenStack Python project. commit_message:
Remove rocky branch from periodic-stable templates

All the project that had periodic-stable-jobs template set in their
stable/rocky branch have transitioned to End of Life, and their
branches were deleted [1]. This patch removes stable/rocky from the
template as it is not needed anymore.

[1] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2023-January/031922.html

Change-Id: I74c3a368fccedd4c1c023699535d5dcc7c00923c

commit_message:
Reduce the tempest concurrency for a few jobs

The lvm-lio job family, the cbak-ceph job and
the lvm-multiattach job (especially the latter)
fail very frequently.
They used to run with --concurrency 6 on the gates,
a lower concurrency level can help with resource issues.

Change-Id: I108b60c289acace9e17fa9cb78f84489989d5171

commit_message:
[wallaby] Ensure get_requests_for_local_unit doesn't fail on incomplete relation

This is a rebuild/make sync for charms to pickup the fix in charmhelpers to fix
any inadvertant accesses of ['ca'] in the relation data before it is available
from vault in the certificates relation.  Fix in charmhelpers is in [1].

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/829
Closes-Bug: #2028683

Change-Id: Ie77594327658bb52cf72c5cf8d82fa4a0525fdf5

commit_message:
Update job config.

In Switch to 2023.2 testing runtime py version (7f56f206e6) we added
the openstack-python3-jobs template to the zuul config.  This doesn't
work for the elections repo as we don't have a pep8 target, and we also
do not want to add publish-openstack-python-branch-tarball to the
promote pipeline.

Instead just opencode the python jobs.

Change-Id: I289f16d95e19da2e546300dd2a2376f2ccd3ac86

commit_message:
Continue same set of jobs running for stable/2023.2

We are near to the release of 2023.2 and release team
is starting to create the stable/2023.2 (for lib) soon.
To continue testing the same set of job (py3.9 and py3.11
n-v tox jobs, this change adds the stable/2023.2 in branch
variant for applicable jobs for 2023.2 release.

This way any early cut stable/2023.2 as well as for projects
still have master for stable/2023.2 will continue testing the
same set of jobs we do during 2023.2 release (current master).

Change-Id: I53134ef9b57e9434b8916e4fd146010074d88d59

commit_message:
Move integration jobs to Ubuntu 22.04 (Jammy)

I noticed the confluent-kafka package isn't compatible with the version
of librdkafka-dev provided on Jammy [1][2]. Thankfully they provide a
binary wheel though.

[1] https://github.com/confluentinc/confluent-kafka-python/blob/v1.9.2/src/confluent_kafka/src/confluent_kafka.h#L59
[2] https://packages.ubuntu.com/jammy/librdkafka-dev

Change-Id: If55f246d9d2a990f2389d14d7bda22a82d9bb43c
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[wallaby] Ensure get_requests_for_local_unit doesn't fail on incomplete relation

This is a rebuild/make sync for charms to pickup the fix in charmhelpers to fix
any inadvertant accesses of ['ca'] in the relation data before it is available
from vault in the certificates relation.  Fix in charmhelpers is in [1].

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/829
Closes-Bug: #2028683

Change-Id: Ie5fcf1db9033668c72f7aa09240915b9bf1ec851
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-api refs/changes/57/891857/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
